info.game_comments:
2006 Celebrity Jeopardy! game 8.
From Radio City Music Hall in New York City.

jeopardy_round: THE LONG & THE SHORT OF IT

(1, 1).clue: 600-pound Mahala Mullins won fame by selling this illegal "lunar" liquor in the Tenn. mountains

(2, 1).clue: WWNO & WNOE were 2 sources of important info in this city following the disaster brought on by Katrina

(3, 1).clue: Of 25,000, 250,000 or 1 million miles, the one closest to the length of the equator

(4, 1).clue: Though in Arabic his first & middle names mean "little warrior", there's nothing little about this 7'1" Miami center

(5, 1).clue: Regarding Brad Pitt's new hairdo, in 2005 this ex said, "Billy Idol called--he wants his look back"

(1, 2).clue: She gained 30 pounds before playing serial killer Aileen Wuornos for the 2000 film "Monster"

(2, 2).clue: In this city, KFWB hosts "Traffic on the Ones" to help you avoid getting stuck on the freeways

(4, 2).clue: (Before the clue is given, Daniel Reichard, John Lloyd Young, Christian Hoff, and J. Robert Spencer from the Broadway hit Jersey Boys perform.)"Big girls don't cry-y-y (they don't cry) /Big girls don't cry (I wonder why) /(Silly boy) Told my girl we had to break up /(Silly boy) Thought that she would call my bluff /(Silly boy) Then she said to my surprise /'Big girls don't cry'""Jersey Boys" tells the rags-to-rock-to-riches story of this legendary group

(5, 2).clue: "The Late Shift" depicted these 2 real-life hosts jockeying for the late-night crown

(1, 3).clue: After winning an Emmy playing Ellenor Frutt on "The Practice", this actress said, "This is for all the fat girls!"

(5, 3).clue: For "The Simple Life", Paris Hilton wanted Kimberly Stewart to replace this BFF with whom she was feuding

(1, 4).clue: Vantile Mack, the 257-pound "Giant Baby", & 628-pound Jane Campbell were seen at this showman's American Museum

(5, 4).clue: Justin Timberlake won no fans by sniping that this 2006 American Idol "can't carry a tune in a bucket"

(5, 5).clue: The feud between this actress & Shirley MacLaine, her onscreen mom in "Terms of Endearment", is legendary

(1, 1).clue: This percentage in the 2004 presidential election was 64%, up 4% from 2000--who says we're apathetic?

(2, 1).clue: On his final "Tonight Show" on May 22, 1992, he said, "I am taking the applause sign with me (&) putting it in the bedroom"

(5, 1).clue: In "The Enterprise Incident" episode of "Star Trek", he pretended to kill Kirk using the Vulcan Death Grip

(6, 1).clue: The first one in the Bill of Rights deals with the freedom of speech

(1, 2).clue: Of the 3 branches of government, the one including the Supreme Court

(2, 2).clue: This Chicago mobster claimed his famous nickname came from a WWI wound

(5, 2).clue: Forest Lawn is one of these in Glendale, 15 minutes from Hollywood--for some, a one-way trip

(6, 2).clue: This is the 2-word rhyming phrase for a minor car crash

(1, 3).clue: 51 men have held this post that tells members of the House when they get to talk

(2, 3).clue: Do you feel lucky?  Well, do you, punk? Then you'll know he was once the outlaw Josey Wales

(5, 3).clue: On his deathbed, Andrew Jackson addressed his slaves, saying he'd see them here

(6, 3).clue: Many out-of-work actors make ends meet as mixologists, this profession

(1, 4).clue: Alaskans vote every 10 years on whether to hold one of these conventions, like the USA's in 1787

(2, 4).clue: He's owned the New York Post, 20th Century Fox & DirecTV; one of you 3 probably worked for him at one point

(5, 4).clue: Located at the Polunsky Unit in Polk County, the cells in Texas' one of these are each 60 square feet with a window

(6, 4).clue: The U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service lists the spotted owl & the Florida panther as this type of at-risk species

(1, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew stands outside the Merrimack Restaurant in New Hampshire.) This Colorado senator was one of the many politicos to come to the Merrimack Restaurant in Manchester, New Hampshire ahead of the big primary

(2, 5).clue: In 1981 he became Assoc. Attorney General of the U.S.; in 1994, he was a mayor; he's a bit coy about his 2008 plans

(5, 5).clue: The title character in this Arthur Miller play first enters carrying his sample cases

(6, 5).clue: Keep on schedule with the Hebrew, Muslim, Julian or Gregorian one of these

(0, 0).clue: The only tie in the Best Musical category came in 1960, between "The Sound of Music" & this show about a NYC mayor
